verses.text: Woe be unto the pastors that destroy and scatter the sheep of my pasture ! saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.

Therefore thus saith the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* God of Israel against the pastors that feed my people ; Ye have scattered my flock , and driven them away , and have not visited them: behold, I will visit upon you the evil of your doings , saith the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*.
And I will gather the remnant of my flock out of all countries whither I have driven them, and will bring them again to their folds ; and they shall be fruitful and increase.
And I will set up shepherds over them which shall feed them: and they shall fear no more, nor be dismayed , neither shall they be lacking , saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*. \p

¶ Behold, the days come , saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, that I will raise unto David a righteous Branch , and a King shall reign and prosper , and shall execute judgment and justice in the earth.

In his days Judah shall be saved , and Israel shall dwell safely : and this \add is\add* his name whereby he shall be called , THE \nd LORD\nd* OUR RIGHTEOUSNESS.\f + \fr 23.6 \ft THE \+nd LORD\+nd*…: Heb. Jehovah-tsidkenu\f*

Therefore, behold, the days come , saith the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, that they shall no more say , The 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* liveth , which brought up the children of Israel out of the land of Egypt ;

But, The \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* liveth , which brought up and which led the seed of the house of Israel out of the north country , and from all countries whither I had driven them; and they shall dwell in their own land. \p

¶ Mine heart within me is broken because of the prophets ; all my bones shake ; I am like a drunken man , and like a man whom wine hath overcome , because of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, and because of the words of his holiness.

For the land is full of adulterers ; for because of swearing the land mourneth ; the pleasant places of the wilderness are dried up , and their course is evil , and their force \add is\add* not right.\f + \fr 23.10 \ft swearing: or, cursing\f*\f + \fr 23.10 \ft course: or, violence\f*
For both prophet and priest are profane ; yea, in my house have I found their wickedness , saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.

Wherefore their way shall be unto them as slippery \add ways\add* in the darkness : they shall be driven on , and fall therein: for I will bring evil upon them, \add even\add* the year of their visitation , saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.
And I have seen folly in the prophets of Samaria ; they prophesied in Baal , and caused my people Israel to err.\f + \fr 23.13 \ft folly: or, an absurd thing: Heb. unsavoury\f*

I have seen also in the prophets of Jerusalem an horrible thing : they commit adultery , and walk in lies : they strengthen also the hands of evildoers , that none doth return from his wickedness : they are all of them unto me as Sodom , and the inhabitants thereof as Gomorrah.\f + \fr 23.14 \ft an…: or, filthiness\f*

Therefore thus saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* of hosts concerning the prophets ; Behold, I will feed them with wormwood , and make them drink the water of gall : for from the prophets of Jerusalem is profaneness gone forth into all the land.\f + \fr 23.15 \ft profaneness: or, hypocrisy\f*

Thus saith the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* of hosts , Hearken not unto the words of the prophets that prophesy unto you: they make you vain : they speak a vision of their own heart , \add and\add* not out of the mouth of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*.

They say still unto them that despise me, The \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* hath said , Ye shall have peace ; and they say unto every one that walketh after the imagination of his own heart , No evil shall come upon you.\f + \fr 23.17 \ft imagination: or, stubbornness\f*

For who hath stood in the counsel of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, and hath perceived and heard his word ? who hath marked his word , and heard \add it\add*?\f + \fr 23.18 \ft counsel: or, secret\f*
Behold, a whirlwind of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* is gone forth in fury , even a grievous whirlwind : it shall fall grievously upon the head of the wicked.

The anger of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* shall not return , until he have executed , and till he have performed the thoughts of his heart : in the latter days ye shall consider it perfectly.
I have not sent these prophets , yet they ran : I have not spoken to them, yet they prophesied.
But if they had stood in my counsel , and had caused my people to hear my words , then they should have turned them from their evil way , and from the evil of their doings.
\add Am\add* I a God at hand , saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, and not a God afar off ?

Can any hide himself in secret places that I shall not see him? saith the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*. Do not I fill heaven and earth ? saith the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*.
I have heard what the prophets said , that prophesy lies in my name , saying , I have dreamed , I have dreamed.
How long shall \add this\add* be in the heart of the prophets that prophesy lies ? yea, \add they are\add* prophets of the deceit of their own heart ;
Which think to cause my people to forget my name by their dreams which they tell every man to his neighbour , as their fathers have forgotten my name for Baal.

The prophet that hath a dream , let him tell a dream ; and he that hath my word , let him speak my word faithfully. What \add is\add* the chaff to the wheat ? saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*.\f + \fr 23.28 \ft that hath a dream: Heb. with whom is, etc\f*
\add Is\add* not my word like as a fire ? saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*; and like a hammer \add that\add* breaketh the rock in pieces ?
Therefore, behold, I \add am\add* against the prophets , saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, that steal my words every one from his neighbour.
Behold, I \add am\add* against the prophets , saith the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, that use their tongues , and say , He saith.\f + \fr 23.31 \ft that…: or, that smooth their tongues\f*

Behold, I \add am\add* against them that prophesy false dreams , saith the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, and do tell them, and cause my people to err by their lies , and by their lightness ; yet I sent them not, nor commanded them: therefore they shall not profit this people at all , saith the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*. \p

¶ And when this people , or the prophet , or a priest , shall ask thee, saying , What \add is\add* the burden of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*? thou shalt then say unto them, What burden ? I will even forsake you, saith the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*.

And \add as for\add* the prophet , and the priest , and the people , that shall say , The burden of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, I will even punish that man and his house.\f + \fr 23.34 \ft punish: Heb. visit upon\f*

Thus shall ye say every one to his neighbour , and every one to his brother , What hath the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* answered ? and, What hath the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* spoken ?

And the burden of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* shall ye mention no more: for every man’s word shall be his burden ; for ye have perverted the words of the living God , of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* of hosts our God.

Thus shalt thou say to the prophet , What hath the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* answered thee? and, What hath the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* spoken ?

But since ye say , The burden of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*; therefore thus saith the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*; Because ye say this word , The burden of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, and I have sent unto you, saying , Ye shall not say , The burden of the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*;
Therefore, behold, I, even I, will utterly forget you, and I will forsake you, and the city that I gave you and your fathers , \add and cast you\add* out of my presence :
And I will bring an everlasting reproach upon you, and a perpetual shame , which shall not be forgotten.
